title: Rolling decreasing force applied to cylinder

content.question: A cylinder rolls without slipping on a horizontal surface, as shown in the figure. The cylinder is initially at rest, and, starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a variable horizontal force <math alttext="F sub horizontal, end sub, of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>horiz</mtext></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> is exerted at the center of the cylinder. As shown in the graph of <math alttext="F sub horizontal, end sub, of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>horiz</mtext></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>, the magnitude of <math alttext="F sub horizontal, end sub, of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>horiz</mtext></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> decreases linearly for <math alttext="t is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Which of the following is a true statement about the frictional force exerted on the cylinder by the surface during the time interval shown in the graph?

choices.label: The frictional force initially increases until the cylinder reaches its maximum speed, and then decreases.
